segment.source: How to Install and Configure the Default Application
segment.target: How to Install and Configure the Default Application

segment.source: How to Install and Configure the Default Application
segment.target: How to Install and Configure the Default Application

segment.source: How to Install and Configure the Default Application
segment.target: How to Install and Configure the Default Application

segment.source: The default application is provided as part of the installation and is automatically copied to the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Server during installation.
segment.target: The default application is provided as part of the installation and is automatically copied to the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Server during installation.

segment.source: It is used to verify that the Management Server was installed and configured correctly, but it has to be published to the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Client so that the user can access it.
segment.target: It is used to verify that the Management Server was installed and configured correctly, but it has to be published to the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Client so that the user can access it.

segment.source: Use the following procedures to publish the default application and to stream it.
segment.target: Use the following procedures to publish the default application and to stream it.

segment.source: To publish the default application
segment.target: To publish the default application

segment.source: Log on to the App-V Management Server by using an account that is a member of the App-V Administrators group specified during installation.
segment.target: Log on to the App-V Management Server by using an account that is a member of the App-V Administrators group specified during installation.

segment.source: On the App-V Management Server, click Start, click Administrative Tools, and then click Application Virtualization Management Console.
segment.target: On the App-V Management Server, click Start, click Administrative Tools, and then click Application Virtualization Management Console.

segment.source: In the App-V Management Console, click Actions, and then click Connect to Application Virtualization System.
segment.target: In the App-V Management Console, click Actions, and then click Connect to Application Virtualization System.

segment.source: On the Configure Connection page, clear the Use Secure Connection check box.
segment.target: On the Configure Connection page, clear the Use Secure Connection check box.

segment.source: In the Web Service Host Name box, type the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the App-V Management Server, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Web Service Host Name box, type the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the App-V Management Server, and then click OK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can also use localhost for the Web Service Host name if it is installed on the Management Server.
segment.target: You can also use localhost for the Web Service Host name if it is installed on the Management Server.

segment.source: In the App-V Management Console, right-click the Server node, and click System Options.
segment.target: In the App-V Management Console, right-click the Server node, and click System Options.

segment.source: On the General tab, in the Default Content Path box, enter the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path to the Content folder you created on the server during installation; for example, Server NameContent, and then click OK.
segment.target: On the General tab, in the Default Content Path box, enter the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path to the Content folder you created on the server during installation; for example, Server NameContent, and then click OK.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Use the FQDN for the server name so that the client can resolve the name correctly.
segment.target: Use the FQDN for the server name so that the client can resolve the name correctly.

segment.source: In the App-V Management Console, in the navigation pane, expand the Server node, and then click Applications.
segment.target: In the App-V Management Console, in the navigation pane, expand the Server node, and then click Applications.

segment.source: In the topic pane, click Default Application, and then, in the Actions pane, click Properties.
segment.target: In the topic pane, click Default Application, and then, in the Actions pane, click Properties.

segment.source: In the Properties dialog box, next to the OSD Path box, click Browse.
segment.target: In the Properties dialog box, next to the OSD Path box, click Browse.

segment.source: In the Open dialog box, enter the UNC path to the Content folder you created on the server during installation; for example, Server NameContent, and press ENTER.
segment.target: In the Open dialog box, enter the UNC path to the Content folder you created on the server during installation; for example, Server NameContent, and press ENTER.

segment.source: You must use the actual server name and cannot use the localhost here.
segment.target: You must use the actual server name and cannot use the localhost here.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Ensure that the values in both the OSD Path and Icon Path boxes are in UNC format (for example, Server NameContentDefaultApp.ico), and point to the Content folder you created when installing the server.
segment.target: Ensure that the values in both the OSD Path and Icon Path boxes are in UNC format (for example, Server NameContentDefaultApp.ico), and point to the Content folder you created when installing the server.

segment.source: Do not use localhost or a file path containing a drive letter such as C:Program Files....Content.
segment.target: Do not use localhost or a file path containing a drive letter such as C:Program Files....Content.

segment.source: Select the DefaultApp.osd file, and click Open.
segment.target: Select the DefaultApp.osd file, and click Open.

segment.source: Repeat the previous steps to configure the icon path.
segment.target: Repeat the previous steps to configure the icon path.

segment.source: Click the Access Permissions tab, and confirm that the App-V Users group has access permissions to the application.
segment.target: Click the Access Permissions tab, and confirm that the App-V Users group has access permissions to the application.

segment.source: Click the Shortcuts tab, and then click Publish to User’s Desktop.
segment.target: Click the Shortcuts tab, and then click Publish to User’s Desktop.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Open Windows Explorer, and locate the Content directory.
segment.target: Open Windows Explorer, and locate the Content directory.

segment.source: Double-click the DefaultApp.osd file, and open it with Notepad.
segment.target: Double-click the DefaultApp.osd file, and open it with Notepad.

segment.source: Locate the line that contains the HREF tag, and change it to the following code:
segment.target: Locate the line that contains the HREF tag, and change it to the following code:

segment.source: Or, if you are using RTSPS:
segment.target: Or, if you are using RTSPS:

segment.source: Close the DefaultApp.osd file, and save the changes.
segment.target: Close the DefaultApp.osd file, and save the changes.

segment.source: To stream the default application
segment.target: To stream the default application

segment.source: On the computer that has the App-V Client installed, log on as a user who is a member of the Application Virtualization Users group specified during server installation.
segment.target: On the computer that has the App-V Client installed, log on as a user who is a member of the Application Virtualization Users group specified during server installation.

segment.source: On the desktop, the Default Application Virtualization Application shortcut appears.
segment.target: On the desktop, the Default Application Virtualization Application shortcut appears.

segment.source: Double-click the shortcut to start the application.
segment.target: Double-click the shortcut to start the application.

segment.source: A status bar, displayed above the Windows notification area, reports that the application is starting.
segment.target: A status bar, displayed above the Windows notification area, reports that the application is starting.

segment.source: If the application startup is successful, the title screen for the default application is displayed.
segment.target: If the application startup is successful, the title screen for the default application is displayed.

segment.source: Click OK to close the dialog box.
segment.target: Click OK to close the dialog box.

segment.source: You have now confirmed that the App-V system is running correctly.
segment.target: You have now confirmed that the App-V system is running correctly.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: How to Configure Servers for Server-Based Deployment
